title.narrative: Mobilising young women and men to become leaders in promoting environmental justice and SLP

description.narrative: This project is implemented by a consortium of 3 organizations (Caritas Finland, CAFOD and Gaia Organization) and is funded by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Finland. The design responds to the significant need of Myanmar to be able to mitigate and respond to the impact of climate change due to its high vulnerability. This caused in part by increasing deforestation, environmental degradation and an economic model promoted by the government which pursues industrialised agricultural policies over the interests of smallholders. In this regard vulnerability affects in greater part remote rural areas, primarily inhabited by minority ethnic groups and within them mostly to women, youth and other marginalised groups who have limited participation in decision making processes at local and national levels. In this sense, the three organizations formed a partnership in order to be able to mobilise youth and particularly women in order to promote environmental justice and sustainable living practices through three approaches: 1) Engaging, mobilising, and supporting young women and men to lead transformational processes: empowering participants at an individual level to ensure young women and men have a greater understanding and self-awareness of their own agency, gain knowledge and skills related to sustainable living, and are committed to sustainable living practices. 2)Creating space and platforms for dialogue and change: bringing stakeholders together to enable young leaders to dialogue and share ideas thereby dispelling myths and prejudices about other groups/identities, leading to increased social cohesion and solidarity in jointly addressing shared problems, and contributing to relational and social change. 3)Working together on joint actions to achieve sustainable living: conducting action research, advocacy activities and produce publications (on issues identified by the participants e.g. deforestation, waste management, land grabbing).
